message: Undermining the independence and transparency of the Office of Congressional Ethics behind closed doors will only weaken accountability to the American people. By outlawing anonymous complaints, shifting jurisdiction to the Ethics Committee and restricting the ability to communicate with the public, House Republicans are shamelessly attempting to erode any and all ethics standards in this body.
Raising my hand and taking the oath of office will always be a deeply humbling and moving experience. Honored to continue serving the Fourth District of Massachusetts in the 115th Congress!

Martha Minow built her career on one simple truth: the American system of justice only works if each of us has access to it.  For her, the law has always been the strongest tool we have to hold this country accountable to its values.  I am humbled to consider her a mentor and friend and wish her the very best in her next chapter.

I will fight every day with Health Care For All, the Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts Foundation and other partners across our Commonwealth to defend the ACA and access to health care for every American.

Congress took an initial step towards addressing our broken mental health system last year, but troubling flaws remain throughout the full continuum of care. Low Medicaid reimbursement rates are one of the greatest obstacles to treatment for the millions of American suffering from mental illness and substance use disorders. By directing more money for the states to devote to behavioral health care, our Medicaid Bump Act will ensure that patients in every corner of our country have access to the treatment they deserve.   In the year ahead, we can either use last year’s progress as inspiration to continue this fight or we can do irreconcilable damage to our mental health system by repealing the ACA. Reverting back to a system where mental illness and substance use disorders are disqualifying preexisting conditions and our most vulnerable cannot access care through Medicaid expansion would have a devastating impact on all of our communities.

Repealing the Affordable Care Act and gutting Medicaid will leave millions of Americans without access to mental health care. You can read more about why I’m fighting those proposals in this Boston Herald piece.
The House Republican plan to defund Planned Parenthood will hit MassHealth patients hardest - $2 million in services cut and thousands of patients denied access to health care.

Rights without the vigorous, steadfast defense of our nation’s top justice official become abstract notions rather than sacred promises. Despite well-rehearsed testimony intended to prove otherwise, Senator Jeff Sessions’ record bears witness to an unwavering belief that civil rights should not extend to women, minorities or the LGBT community.  Entrusting the duties and obligations of our Justice Department to a man who opposes the Voting Rights Act, supports a ban on same-sex marriage and rejected the reauthorization of the Violence Against Women Act would halt our country’s march towards equality. I urge my Senate colleagues to oppose his confirmation as Attorney General.

If Republican efforts to cut Medicaid funding for Planned Parenthood are intended to be a warning shot at the constitutionally guaranteed right to have an abortion, my colleagues are missing their target and hurting low-income women and families instead.

From crippling Medicaid to threatening mental health coverage and gutting Planned Parenthood, the Republican budget is a deliberate strike at our country’s most vulnerable patients. Instead of joining us at the table to debate reforms that will strengthen our health care system, my colleagues chose the health of their re-elections over the health of the American people.
In moments of painful division, Martin Luther King Jr. Day is a poignant reminder to pursue justice, unity & peace.

If heartbreaking stories of patients losing insurance aren’t enough, hopefully nonpartisan projections of unaffordable, inaccessible coverage will stop GOP plans to repeal the Affordable Care Act without a replacement.

An Education Secretary must not only protect students and teachers, she should have a basic knowledge of the very fundamental promises we make to them. Failure to understand the laws that guarantee access to education for  students with disabilities or the difference between growth and proficiency is disqualifying for a role that will shape our next generation of students.
As we build on our success expanding access to STEM education for all students, it was humbling to be sworn in for a third term as an honorary co-chair of the Massachusetts STEM Council.
Visited Dell EMC this morning in Hopkinton to catch up with employees and offer to be a partner as they continue to grow.

More than a celebration of any individual, an inauguration is a tribute to a system where the people's voice counts. Over the course of the 2016 campaign we heard in no uncertain terms that too many American families feel forgotten, overlooked and left behind. President Trump made big promises to those families.  It's up to us to work every day to demand that he keep them – not only for the communities that supported his election, but for any American facing injustice or inequity. We will stop at nothing to block the hateful rhetoric and divisive agenda of his campaign from undermining the values that make our country not just great, but good.  President Obama, First Lady Obama and Vice President Biden leave enormous shoes to fill. Against steep odds and through tough terrain, they never stopped fighting for a the simple dignity of anyone who calls this country home.  A grateful nation thanks them for their service.

Combined with yesterday's reinstatement of the global gag rule, H.R. 7 crystalizes the fact that our new GOP-led government sees women's health care as expendable, both within and far beyond our borders. But make no mistake: if my colleagues continue down this path, I know there are a few million women, men and children willing to keep marching.

A great nation does not wall itself in. A confident nation does not close its door to the people that need her protection most. A tolerant nation does not target children who have only known her streets or retaliate against communities that protect their neighbors. And a nation built on the sweat and sacrifice of generations of immigrant families does not take that patriotism for granted.  President Trump’s executive orders today are the actions of a scared government, not a strong one. I urge my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to come together and undo his damage.
Open enrollment for health coverage is still open through Tuesday. Learn more or sign up and get covered by clicking here.
Indifference to injustice only perpetuates violence and hatred. On Holocaust Remembrance Day, we vow to never remain silent again.
Tonight we are fighting with everything we've got for this country's better angels.
Solidarity & strength at Copley Square today. We will march. We will protest. We will fight. And we will win.

Repealing the Affordable Care Act would jeopardize the care that so many receive at community health centers throughout our Commonwealth. Read more about my tour of the Edward M. Kennedy Community Health Center in Worcester.
“We remain humanistic and open-hearted.” Well said Representative Michael E. Capuano.

"The glory of justice and the majesty of law are created not just by the Constitution...but by the men and women who constitute our society - who are the protectors of the law as they are themselves protected by the law." -- Robert F. Kennedy  Thank you, Sally Yates. You gave us something to be proud of tonight.
Today is the last day to #GetCovered for 2017. Learn more and enroll by clicking here!
Heartened to see the Boy Scouts of America give boys like Joe Maldonado the acceptance they deserve.
An Iraqi refugee, a trumpet, and a lesson in our nation’s promise of compassion for President Trump. Watch here:

A Muslim Ban ignores the principles that built this nation and gives into the fear that terrorists aim to create. Proud to sponsor the Statue of Liberty Values Act with so many of my colleagues to overturn our President’s immoral, illegal executive order.
From women's health to worker rights, Neil Gorsuch has shown a troubling lack of commitment to the promise of Equal Justice Under Law above the doors of the Supreme Court.

For every unconstitutional, illegal action taken by the Administration, we must have an independent Attorney General willing to defend the rights of all Americans. With his record of defending voter suppression, undermining LGBT rights and stonewalling gender equity, Senator Jeff Sessions is not that person.  The full Senate should reject his nomination.
If you want to protect Americans, you should close the loophole that allows suspected terrorists to buy guns – not deny students like Waqas Dirar an education.

No matter where you live, if you have coverage or you’re uninsured, repeal of the Affordable Care Act will have seismic, tragic implications for mental health care and substance use disorder treatment. Parity laws guaranteeing coverage will crumble. The end of Medicaid expansion will move care out of reach. And life-saving preventative screenings will no longer be affordable and accessible.
Wheaton College shows that a welcoming society will always be stronger than a reclusive one.

Our students and our teachers deserve an Education Secretary who understands the challenges facing our public education system, who is willing to address unfair student loan debt policies, and who believes a school is no place for guns. By confirming one of their biggest donors, Senate Republicans chose their campaign accounts over their constituents. Now our work begins to hold her accountable for any proposed reforms that will undermine the right to an education for each and every child.
It was true when my uncle said it and it remains true when U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren says it. The failure to protect civil rights and equality at the Department of Justice would be a disgrace.

Half a century ago, civil rights leaders like Martin Luther King Jr., Shirley Chisholm, John Lewis, Rosa Parks and countless others fought and marched not only for their dreams - but for the dreams of future generations. And while we spend Black History Month reflecting on the blood, sweat and tears that made the Civil Rights Act possible, we recognize that for Black America today its promises are too often broken.
Jeff Sessions uses the law to target those it's meant to protect. Our fight to #StopSessions has just begun.
We’re launching our third Tour 34 this Saturday at Needham Town Hall. We’ll be in Powers Hall from 10AM-11AM – hope to see you there!
Sworn in as Attorney General on Thursday, attacking civil rights by Friday. AG Jeff Sessions’ Department of Justice will be exactly as expected. Stay vigilant.
Voices, concerns and priorities of my constituents will always guide my work in Washington. Great turnout in Needham for the first stop on our third Tour 34!

Michael Flynn’s resignation raises more questions than answers. If the transition team promised to reward Russia for interfering with our democratic process by revoking sanctions, the American people deserve to know what guarantees were made, who approved them, and why an incoming administration would endorse Russian cyberattacks on our elections. That’s why I signed onto legislation intended to answer those questions and ensure any conflicts of interest are thoroughly investigated.

Generations of Israelis and Palestinians have painstakingly worked to build the necessary foundation for lasting peace: a two-state solution. Undermining that commitment is not leadership on the part of the United States but reckless disregard for the communities, families and lives impacted by this conflict every single day.
Condemning anti-Semitism should have been the obvious and immediate response to this question.
Let me be very clear, detaining a transgender victim of domestic violence does not make a single person in this country safer.

An immigration policy that operates in the shadows is not just suspicious - it's dangerous. By refusing to offer clear guidance about deportation and enforcement policies to cities and towns, the Trump Administration is stoking fear, handicapping law enforcement, and undermining public safety. That’s why today I wrote a letter to the Department of Homeland Security demanding clarity on their recent raids.

David Friedman has used both hostile actions and divisive language to undermine the peace process for years. One statement of regret cannot paint over a record built on insults aimed at members of the Jewish community and support for destabilizing policies.

The National Guard is not a deportation force. Even suggesting as much undermines the critical work they do to keep our country safe.  But this is par for the course in an Administration that has made the scapegoating of immigrant families a cornerstone of its agenda – and turned a blind eye to the very real, very painful and very human costs of their sloppy policy choices.

Forcing families and neighbors deeper into the cracks of our nation’s broken immigration system will not make our communities more secure or our country stronger.  With these memos, the Trump Administration has decided to prioritize the deportation of terrified children with the same fury as they will violent criminals.  Beyond abandoning any semblance of a humane immigration policy, these instructions will sow distrust and confusion that will jeopardize the safety of our law enforcement and our neighborhoods.

No single person has experienced every struggle or learned every lesson, but united, the American people have the insight and dogged determination to confront this nation's greatest challenges. Our diversity is our ultimate strength. We cannot close our doors to immigrants and refugees, erode the rights of our fellow workers or deny health care to our neighbors. Standing together today at the Irish Famine Memorial, people of all faiths, identities and backgrounds raised their voices to send a clear message that we will persist and we will prevail.
“Putting up walls and deporting members of our communities aren’t going to solve problems of globalization,” Kennedy said. “Ripping parents from their children isn’t going to increase your wages.”

Civil rights are a promise this country makes to each of us. They cannot be rescinded by the careless swipe of a thoughtless pen. The Trump Administration's actions tonight do not change the fact that discrimination is illegal. But they send a devastating message to our transgender students that their President does not find them worthy of equal protection. If President Trump wants to make good on his alleged support for the LGBTQ community, then he and his Attorney General must pledge to defend these critical protections at all costs.
A threat to any civil right is a threat to all civil rights. #ProtectTransKids #EveryoneWelcome

Through their modernization project, Golda Meir will provide compassionate, comfortable affordable housing for our seniors that will allow them to age with dignity. Deeply grateful for the partnership between the Jewish Community Housing for the Elderly, the Department of Housing and Urban Development, and the City of Newton that made today’s groundbreaking possible.

Our health professionals stand on the front lines of our fight for accessible, affordable care for patients across our Commonwealth and country. When they raise their voices to protect the Affordable Care Act, their President and government should listen.

Yesterday I introduced a resolution that would force President Trump to release the details of his health care plan that he promises will insure everyone at lower costs with higher quality care. SHARE this post if you think he shouldn’t make promises that are too “complicated” to keep.
Proud to sit with Jen Fox in the House Chamber tonight. Take a minute to read her story.  When it comes to health care reform the consequences that matter aren't political - they're personal.
Until or unless we are given reason to trust his word, we will judge President Trump based on his actions.
NA

An Attorney General who refuses to defend LGBTQ students from discrimination and to uphold our sacred promise of access to the ballot box is unfit for the office. But last night's reports of Russian contacts followed by misleading statements to the public demand Jeff Sessions' immediate resignation.  There must be an independent investigation into the entire Trump campaign's Russian involvement and zero tolerance for cabinet officials and senior aides who provide false information to the American people. If the Trump Administration has nothing to hide, they have nothing to fear.
Tune in now as Whip Hoyer and I search for GOP's hidden ACA repeal bill.

From education to health care to public safety: transgender Americans are told near daily that their rights count as less. In a country built on the promise of equal protection, that is unacceptable. Today I took over as Chair of the Transgender Equality Task Force and stood with allies and friends united against attacks on any transgender Americans.
I #StandWithPP for the millions of Americans of all ages, genders, incomes, races and faiths who rely on Planned Parenthood every single day.

If there was any doubt about the impact of the Trump Administration’s decision to back away from transgender protections, let that be put to rest today. Their failure to defend the fundamental human rights of all Americans has created a barrier to justice for students across the country. In the face of a White House content to abandon the vigilance that civil rights require, our courts must affirm Title IX protections for transgender Americans and Congress must act to further codify those rights. Gavin Grimm has bravely carried this movement on his shoulders, and we will continue to stand by his side every step of the way.

Instead of making good on the now-empty rhetoric he offered Congress and the American people last week, President Trump today doubled down on fear, division and prejudice. His second attempt at a Muslim and refugee ban will not make our country safer – instead it will further sow global distrust and weaken the critical role the United States has long played in setting the bar for human rights. Closing American doors to our world’s most vulnerable will not mark a proud moment in this country’s history.
No better way to celebrate #ReadAcrossAmerica than with the Cat in the Hat and a few avid readers from Studley Elementary School!
Bomb threats & anti-Semitism cannot be tolerated and will not shake our resolve to fight against bigotry & intolerance.

After weeks of empty promises about a secret plan to insure every American at lower costs with higher quality care, President Trump has thrown his support behind a GOP proposal that fails every one of his guarantees. But more than that, he continues to offer vague assurances that will only increase uncertainty for patients, families and local economies. That's why we must pass my Resolution of Inquiry to move this debate from behind closed doors into the public eye.

Last night, Speaker Ryan called the GOP repeal bill 'an act of mercy.' With due respect to the Speaker, he and I must have read different scripture. The one I read taught that we are judged not by how we treat the powerful but how we care for the least among us. There is no mercy in a system that makes health care a luxury. This bill is no act of mercy. It is an act of malice.
In solidarity. #InternationalWomensDay #ADayWithoutAWoman
Watch GOP lawyers admit that GOP repeal plan will cut off coverage to millions of Americans suffering from mental illness and substance use disorders.
This exchange makes it painfully clear: GOP effort to cut Planned Parenthood funding is about politics, not policy.
Over 24 hours into our hearing and it's crystal clear: GOP repeal bill is no act of mercy. It is an act of malice.
Watch as I offer a resolution to bring this GOP act of malice out of the shadows and into the public view.
Let me be clear. This fight has just begun.

Yesterday we spoke of mercy -- for the elderly, the poor, the sick and the suffering who the GOP repeal plan clearly leaves behind. But this is about more than mercy, it is about common decency. Because there is nothing more universally human than the stubborn truth that fortunes change. That no one among us is immune to illness or addiction or bad luck or real loss.  So we fortify a system of shared protections that are deep and strong enough to catch any brother or sister who falls.  Shame on those who take that protection for granted.
We’re bringing Tour 34 to Taunton on Saturday afternoon for a town hall at Friedman Middle School. Stop by at 1PM to share your concerns and remain engaged!
Our fight to defend a merciful, compassionate health care system is only beginning. We will stay engaged and we will stay vigilant.
NA
Bullies may land a punch. They may leave a mark. But they have never, not once, in the history of our nation, managed to match the strength of a people united in defense of freedom.

Our character isn’t reflected in the promises we make, but in the promises we keep. President Trump looked American families in the eye and told them their health care coverage was safe. This CBO report exposes that for the masquerade it is – one of countless works of fiction peddled to this country for years by Republican leadership unable to see the people behind their politics. May every American citizen hold them accountable for their empty words.
"Health care is about how we treat each other in our times of need." Watch my interview with Morning Joe below.
Watch more of my thoughts on the GOP health care repeal bill here with Chris Hayes.

On the eve of St. Patrick’s Day, I stand as the proud son of Irish immigrants and the humble beneficiary of this country’s golden doors – to deliver one message to immigrant families: President Trump doesn’t speak for all of us. His immigration policies are opposed by leaders in Washington who do not take your patriotism for granted. And we are by your side in the fight ahead.

A government that does not invest in her people does not put America first. President Trump’s budget reinforces inequities in our classrooms, our courtrooms, our behavioral health centers and every community across this country.  It threatens the science that makes us strong, the diplomats that keep us safe, and the local investment on which our entire economy depends.   Most painfully, but least surprisingly, it tries to codify the Trump worldview: that human need is the result of personal shortcoming, rather than systemic injustice.  That those among us who need support – in housing, in health care, in aging, in the simple dignity of putting food on the table for their families – deserve a cold shoulder instead.
The Peace Corps exports and safeguards our nation’s core values of democracy and human rights. Any cut to a program so critical to our global standing should not even be on the table.
Being forced to choose between health care and rent is not freedom.
We will not turn a blind eye to continued acts of hatred against the LGBT community.

TrumpCare is the largest assault on mental health care in recent history. Guaranteed behavioral health coverage will end for millions on Medicaid. Countless others suffering from addiction will be abandoned in the midst of an opioid epidemic. We cannot allow this bill to pass.
Five years ago, I got a call everyone dreads. Read my piece on that moment and the sacred contract of the American health care system.
Health is the great equalizer. No matter your power or privilege, we will all one day find ourselves in need of mercy and care.
President Trump and GOP leaders are negotiating their health care repeal bill behind closed doors. Share this graphic to show them exactly where we stand.
A few of the many unacceptable reasons to take health care from millions of Americans. #TrumpCare -You promised you would on the campaign trail -President Trump asked you to -Wealthy need more money
Debate on today's health care vote has begun, and I'm headed down to the House floor. Share this graphic to stand with us in solidarity.
"Blessed are the merciful. For they will be shown mercy."
NA
Accidental humanity. President Trump & Speaker Ryan create a bill so bad and so harmful that it can’t even get through a body that has voted more than 60 times to repeal the ACA.

Targeted threats against the Jewish community or any other religious group will not shake our resolve for a nation free of bigotry and hatred. That’s why I joined my colleagues from across the country to introduce the bipartisan Combating Anti-Semitism Act that will send a clear message that religious intolerance has no place in our United States.

You cannot conduct an impartial investigation while serving as a surrogate for those you are investigating. Through his actions and his words, Chairman Nunes has been compromised and must recuse himself immediately.

The environment is our ultimate common good – protected and replenished from generation to generation by a shared, deeply American commitment to leave our country stronger than we found it.  President Trump’s executive orders today make us weak. From our economy to our ecosystems, our public health to our global influence, we will pay for these short-sighted actions a hundred times over in the decades to come.
NA
NA
To each and every member of the LGBTQ community, let there be no doubt. You count today, tomorrow and far beyond 2020. You cannot be erased and you will never be ignored.

Attacks against Planned Parenthood didn’t start last week and won’t end with one victory. We stand with Planned Parenthood and the millions of women, men and children they serve because now is the time to remain vigilant. #PinkOut

By being true to himself, Lt. Shachar Erez inspires all of us to stay true to the values that make us strong. As we not only defend transgender equality in our Commonwealth but extend it across our country and beyond our shores, Lt. Erez's story is a testament to the incredible power one individual has to hold their government accountable. #TransVisibility

We had 700+ people show up at our town hall in Newton today, proudly and powerfully raising their voices for a government judged by what it offers - not by what it takes away. Thank you for your commitment. This country is counting on it in the weeks and months ahead.

When it comes to civil rights there are not compromises, negotiations or trade-offs. By barring local anti-discrimination laws, North Carolina is leaving their transgender community without the protections any other citizen enjoys. That is the definition of discrimination.
Our laws reflect the promises we make. Our justice system reflects the promises we keep.

We have a word for civil rights protections that are compromised, watered down or ‘far from perfect’ – discrimination. By falsely claiming that this new legislation restores North Carolina to a pre-HB2 landscape, the NCAA is shamefully giving cover to the systemic suppression of LGBTQ rights, not just in North Carolina but across the country.

Persistent pay discrimination undercuts more than a paycheck. It threatens the basic economic equity that fortifies everything from education to health care to the ability to keep food on the table for your family. Worst of all, it risks infiltrating future generations of the American workforce, entrenching an unequal system for years to  come.

A jurist that defers to corporations and the wealthy at the expense of women’s health and workers’ rights does not deserve a chair on the highest court in our land. Instead of simultaneously weakening the integrity of two separate branches of our government, Senate Republicans should urge President Trump to nominate a judge who believes in our sacred promise of ‘Equal Justice Under Law.’
A great country would contribute more than just outrage. It would offer the terrorized children and families of Syria refuge on its shores.
Assad's vicious brutality demands a response. But this country doesn't fight wars without giving the American people a say.  Read my full statement on tonight's strikes below.
NA
On #OneBostonDay, we remember that the smallest act of kindness can guide a neighbor through tragedy. Learn more at www.onebostonday.org.
A year later and I’m still Stepping Strong w/ Gillian Reny, Brigham and Women's Hospital and trauma survivors across our country. #TBT
For the six million Jewish mothers, fathers, sons and daughters murdered during the Holocaust, today we honor their memories and mourn the lives stolen from them by hatred paired with inaction.

Systemic targeting and killing of a population is genocide. To the over one million Armenians who lost their lives more than a century ago, we promise to hold their stories close and never forget their suffering.

In the latest version of TrumpCare, 'flexibility' for insurance companies means impossible choices for working families. Because the moment Essential Health Benefits become negotiable, they become dispensable.

Men and women willing to sacrifice their lives to protect ours should never be asked to hide their true identity or serve under a leader who believes they are ‘diseased.’ With an estimated 11,000 active transgender soldiers and reservists in our military, the United States Senate should immediately reject Mark Green’s nomination as Secretary of the Army and ensure intolerance can never again permeate our armed forces. Once again, the Trump Administration has demonstrated a devastating disregard for the transgender community.

With their second attempt at TrumpCare, Republican leadership will reserve health care for the wealthy and healthy at the expense of working families and seniors. It is time to raise your voice again and demand a health care system grounded in mercy and compassion.

For anyone with unwanted or expired medication, tomorrow, during National Prescription Drug Take Back Day, you can dispose of them at a site in your community. You can find a location near you by clicking here.
They took a bad bill and made it worse. Trumpcare 2.0 could be on the House Floor this week. Raise your voices and help us fight back.

We #RiseUp united as a nation fiercely proud of its immigrant history. Not only will we defend our friends and neighbors no matter their place of birth, we will celebrate the diversity that makes us strong and kind.
Speaker Ryan said the GOP has a "moral obligation" to roll back the ACA's protections. I have a different take. Watch here.
"No parent should ever have to decide if they can afford to save their child's life."  Thank you, Jimmy Kimmel, for a universal gut check.
Who you worship. What you look like. Who you love. Our differences make us strong – not weak. Thanks to the Religious Action Center of Reform Judaism for raising your voices.

The most shameful moments in this nation’s history share a common villain: a government that decided certain lives count less. Today we proudly introduced the Equality Act, led by Congressman David Cicilline, to finally and fully codify civil rights protections for the LGBTQ community.

Every day, American families and communities are bravely waging battle against an opioid epidemic and mental health crisis that has our country in its grip. President Trump and Speaker Ryan's response? A bill that represents the largest assault on mental health care in a generation.

Let's be crystal clear about the current GOP health care bill: "Americans with pre-existing conditions will be stuck in second-class health care coverage – if they are able to obtain coverage at all." (American Medical Association (AMA))

TrumpCare is an attempt at a separate but equal health care system. One set of rules for the healthy and wealthy. And another for the sick and suffering. Only you can stop it. Raise your voices and reject this dangerous worldview.
On the House floor in a few minutes to weigh in on Trumpcare.  Tune in to join the debate.

TrumpCare codifies a worldview that divides America by fate and fortune. A worldview that scapegoats the struggling and suffering and that see illness as inadequacy. The ultimate test of our country’s character is not the power we give the strong, but the strength we give the weak.

Health care is our ultimate equalizer. No matter your power or privilege, we will all wake up one day in need of a little mercy. Trumpcare rejects that common humanity and continues the Administration’s calculated attempt to divide up our nation based on fate, fortune and difference.  It creates one system for the powerful and another for the poor, one set of rules for the strong and another for the suffering.   If there is any silver lining to this vote it is that the American people are engaged, awake and on notice like never before. It is a long road to the President's desk. We will be fighting every step of the way.
“There is no moral value in telling people you can’t have access to health care.” Watch my interview with Katie Couric on Yahoo News.

For Republicans, passing their health care bill through the House was supposed to be the easy part. We’re talking about a Chamber that has voted more than 60 times to repeal the ACA. Make no mistake, this fight is just beginning. And with leaders like U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren, Senator Jeff Merkley and Senator Tammy Baldwin in the ring, I’m feeling good about our chances.

Our men and women in uniform represent the very best of our country, especially our diversity. Today the American people raised their voices to stop President Trump’s intolerant nominee for Army Secretary.
NA

For thousands of students on playgrounds around our country, Playworks promotes cooperation, health and productivity during and after recess. Read about my visit to a Playworks New England program at Greene Elementary School in Fall River by clicking here.
Flynn. Sessions. Page. Manafort. Comey. More questions raised than answered. We need an independent investigation into Trump campaign ties to Russia now.

On this day a year ago, George Heath gave his life to protect countless others. Honored to join his wife, Rosemary, Governor Baker, Lieutenant Governor Polito, Mayor Hoye and the Carnegie Hero Fund Commission to celebrate his memory this morning.

Russia interfered in our election not only to erode faith in this democracy -- but to undermine the institutions that protect its integrity. With every reckless act of self-preservation, President Trump is allowing that distrust to fester and grow. Only an independent investigation can restore accountability to the American people. If the Trump Administration has nothing to hide, they have nothing to fear.
Wishing a happy Mothers Day to all of the moms & grandmothers enjoying today!

At a moment of persistent distrust in the American system, our need for steady and credible leadership has never been greater. President Trump has failed this test at every turn, from continued attempts to influence investigations into his Administration to the reported leak of classified information to the Russian government. Only a thoroughly independent investigation and a vigilant system of checks and balances in Congress can give the American people the answers they deserve.

Russia has a simple goal: to undermine the system, the institutions, and the freedoms that generations of Americans have fought and died to protect. That’s why I introduced an amendment this week to facilitate an independent investigation into the Trump campaign’s alleged collusions with Russia. Now it’s up to Republican leadership to decide whether this proposal will see a vote. Our system of checks and balances has never been more important. Every single Member of Congress should be demanding answers.

I introduced an amendment today to initiate an independent investigation into Michael Flynn's resignation and alleged collusion, conflicts of interest and business ties between President Trump & Russia. GOP leadership struck it down tonight, refusing to allow it to come to the floor for a simple vote. The reported Comey memos make it clear that we can't wait another day. The time for party politics has long passed. This is about the responsibility that every Member of Congress shares to the system -- and the citizens -- we all swore to protect.
Love is love. And shame on any country, government or president that says otherwise.

Ever present and always brave, police officers risk their lives for ours. During National Police Week, we thank them for not only wearing their badge, but for bearing the responsibility and sacrifice that comes with it.
NA

Tomorrow we’re hosting an event at the Attleboro Arts Museum to celebrate some of the great high school artists we have in the 4th District. Stop by anytime from 10:30AM until noon to check out their artwork!

Several communities across Massachusetts face child lead levels two or three times as high as Flint, Michigan during the peak of the city's crisis.   Trump's misguided cuts to lead reduction programs are the latest sacrifice he's willing to make on the backs of working families and communities.

As any American family knows, budgets reflect deeply personal, often painful, choices about values, priorities and necessities.  The President’s budget reveals his evident belief that the economic dignity of working men and women is expendable. It tells those touched by illness, aging, disability, job loss or other circumstances beyond control that their future – and their family -- is worth less. And it spells out the Trump worldview in devastating detail: a place where health care and education and our most human needs, like food and shelter, are provided based on wealth and power.

For generations, underinvestment throughout our entire mental health care system has left millions of Americans without access to treatment until it is too late. With deeply misplaced pride, President Trump and a Republican Congress immediately responded to our nation’s ongoing mental health crisis and opioid epidemic by shamelessly celebrating the passage of the single largest attack on behavioral health care in recent history. The Administration’s budget follows in the footsteps of TrumpCare by attacking millions of Americans suffering from mental illness and addiction through draconian cuts to critical community mental health programs.

President Trump’s praise of Rodrigo Duterte shows not only an alarming unwillingness to defend human rights, but a fundamental misunderstanding of addiction. From his devastating health care bill to his heartless budget to his comments to Duterte, our President has shown a disturbing instinct to criminalize, scorn, and scapegoat those suffering from substance use disorders and mental illness.

Beneath the devastating numbers released today lies physical, emotional and undeniable pain for families in every corner of this country. TrumpCare destroys the fundamentally American promise that we care for each other in our time of need and divides the fortunate from the vulnerable. This CBO score only confirms that this cruel repeal bill is nothing more than a tax cut for the wealthy paid for with the health and economic security of hard working families.

On Memorial Day, we honor the men and women who gave their lives for ours and make good on our promise to never forget their sacrifice.

Let’s be the country that gave the world the Peace Corps. The country that conquered the moon.  The country that refuses to set anything less than the high water mark for human rights. That sees dignity in diversity. That keeps its promises. That isn’t just great, but good.

President John F. Kennedy didn't just call on a generation to serve. He promised them a country worthy of their service. A nation fearless enough to conquer the moon. Confident enough  to carry the weak on its strong shoulders. Fair enough that no man, woman or child could be told they mattered less.  It was the lesson of a lifetime for a boy who made his way from the dining room table of a big, Irish family, to the bunks and brotherhood of the United States Navy, the tight-knit chambers of the U.S. Senate, and the highest helm of a messy, mighty, melting pot of a country: our stories are linked. I cannot separate my fate from yours. Your despair is mine. My triumph, yours. None of us can do it alone.

With extraordinary courage and conviction, Jack Hurley served our nation during the Battle of Okinawa and throughout World War II. Deeply humbled to play a small part in preserving his story for generations to come as part of the Library of Congress Veterans History Project.

For American families, businesses and communities, climate change isn’t just about the next generation – it’s about the next week. Today, our cities and towns are being battered by severe weather. Our homes are being threatened by rising sea levels. Our industry is being crippled by fire and drought, and our children are growing up with polluted land and polluted lungs. President Trump’s threatened withdrawal from the Paris Climate Agreement won’t just undermine global leadership and abandon moral responsibility, it will actively sacrifice the immediate health and safety of American citizens.

TrumpCare would leave mothers with unaffordable bills simply for starting a family. Cuts to Planned Parenthood would leave countless women without access to life-saving preventative care. And the Trump Administration's decision to eliminate guaranteed coverage for contraception will allow a boss to impose their personal religious beliefs on their employees’ health care options. The record is clear:  President Trump is intent on codifying gender discrimination throughout our entire health care system.

Confronting climate change is not just about the cities and towns under water tomorrow, it is about the children, families, businesses and communities suffering the consequences today – in rising energy costs, lost jobs, crumbling infrastructure, and strapped municipal budgets. Under the Paris Climate Agreement, a global community of different beliefs, nationalities, languages, economies and ecosystems united against one common enemy that threatens the health and safety of us all. Today the President left Americans to fend for themselves.
Great morning talking health care and strengthening our local economies with the Brookline Chamber of Commerce!
You won’t find many audiences more attentive than the 1st grade class at Peter Thacher Elementary School - big thanks to Malcolm for the invite!
Let's be a country that keeps its promises.
"I deserve to be able to show up to my life as the person I am."    Grateful for the courage and grace Asa Sevelius showed our Commonwealth and country today. Proud to stand with him.
There has been a lot of talk about loyalty over the past 24 hours. Americans should never have to doubt the loyalty of their Commander-in-Chief.

Voter fraud is one of the oldest dog whistles in American politics. In light of a continued, nationwide campaign of voter suppression, states like Massachusetts must lead the way in defending access to the ballot box. Read my testimony in favor of automatic voter registration here.

When the American people were forced to bail out Wall Street’s reckless habits in the midst of the recession, we promised to never ask them to bear that burden again. With today’s vote to cripple critical Dodd Frank protections, House GOP is resurrecting the exact same conditions that left countless working families without a roof over their head.

There is nothing to celebrate in James Comey’s testimony today. Under oath he outlined a foreign adversary actively eroding our democratic process, an Attorney General who is compromised beyond repair, and a President of the United States who lied to the American people. Recovering from this profound loss of trust in our most sacred institutions requires nothing less than a relentless pursuit of facts wherever they may lead.
Don't let this one go unnoticed today.

There is no excuse for shaming and starving a child because they can’t afford lunch. Not in the wealthiest country on earth.  Proud to sign onto Congresswoman Michelle Lujan Grisham's Anti-Lunch Shaming Act.
A year ago today LGBTQ lives were specifically targeted and senselessly taken at Pulse nightclub. In their honor, may each of us make a stand - big or small - for a country where hate has no cover.
Praying for Steve Scalise, staff, Capitol Police and other victims of this horrific attack.

Today Americans are united in our grief, our heavy hearts, our gratitude for quiet heroes and our resolve to come together, to be a better version of the country we love. We keep Steve Scalise, Zack Barth, Matt Mika, Crystal Griner and David Bailey in our prayers.  But we are also united by an unsettling feeling that this has gone too far, that in recent years our political system has given intolerance unprecedented cover and inexplicably excused those who scapegoat, target or hate.   The responsibility for today's vicious attack lays squarely at the feet of the gunman. But the responsibility for where we go from here lies in the hands of a nation that must show more than unity of reaction, but unity of response.

Russia’s attack on our election was not guided by party affiliation but instead by a deep desire to weaken trust in our institutions and shake the very foundation of our democracy. Without a strong, coordinated response from our government, adversarial assaults on our electoral system, economy and national security will only become more sophisticated and sustained in the coming years. That's why today I introduced legislation to create a National Russian Threat Response Center that would unite our agencies and our allies against this common threat.

Alongside the Legal Services Corporation, Congresswoman Susan W. Brooks and Coach Jim Harbaugh, we are fighting to make good on the sacred promise of ‘Equal Justice Under Law’ in our civil courtrooms.
It's a good night for baseball.
Happy Father's Day to everyone celebrating today!

Throughout our Commonwealth, there is one connective thread that can be traced across industries, regions and generations: a fierce pride in product. With today’s opening of the Advanced Functional Fabrics of America manufacturing institute at MIT, we will not only honor that tradition, but usher in a new era of textiles and innovation that will call Massachusetts home.

Habitat for Humanity is about more than just building homes, it’s about building compassionate, caring communities. Deeply humbled to play a small part in welcoming Sandra Hovagimian and her sons, Khris and Kevin, into their new home in Attleboro.
Our laws should apply equally to every single American. The President is no exception and the Constitution’s emoluments clause isn’t optional.

For nearly two decades, Bristol Community College President Jack Sbrega welcomed every student with a smile and transformed his campuses into communities. So moving to walk beside him on a tour of the new health and science building that will bear his name and carry on his legacy.
Thank you Ryan O'Callaghan for being who you are and reminding us what Pride is all about.

In a nation fiercely proud of our democracy, legislation should not be drafted behind closed doors, shielded from the bright light of transparency. Drafting TrumpCare under the cover of darkness is an admission that this bill cannot withstand the sunlight of our neighbors and fellow citizens.
Today we found out why Senate Republicans wrote their version of TrumpCare behind closed doors. Tune in now to hear how we push back.
'The America that I know doesn’t tell the sick, the elderly, or the frail that you are on your own. TrumpCare does.'

This is the smile of a girl who is going to become a big sister! Lauren and I are so happy to announce that Eleanor's baby brother will be joining us in December. We are thrilled and grateful. Thank you all for the well wishes and continued support!

Under TrumpCare, three million kids could lose access to health coverage. You and I might disagree on a whole lots of things. Whether this country should do everything in its power to help a child in need is probably not one of them.
Any heart left in this health care plan just broke.

This week, we as a nation will decide whether health care is a right for all or a privilege for the fortunate few. Tune in here as I break down the latest analysis on exactly how TrumpCare will hit working families.

Just landed in Washington and gearing up for this week’s TrumpCare fight. These graphs clearly illustrate the damage this legislation will do to Americans of all income levels, backgrounds and zip codes. SHARE them with your friends to help us underscore the urgency we face over the next four days.
TrumpCare in one graph. A massive tax break for the already wealthy paid for with the health of working class families.

Whether you’re welcoming a new child into this world or watching a loved one pass through it, our health care system uniquely touches every American family. That is why we are fighting against a bill that fundamentally abandons that promise we make to each other.

The United States Capitol belongs to you – not those of us who work inside it. In the hours ahead, we need your voices to echo through every backroom where Republican Senators are negotiating your health care in secret. They work for you. Hold them accountable. Refuse to be ignored.

Tune in to Rep. Debbie Dingell's page today at 5PM for our live conversation on the impact TrumpCare will have on patients and families across the country. We’ll answer as many of your questions as we can!

You cannot advocate for comprehensive mental health reform and then stand on the opposite side of every major mental health organization in the country. Because they all agree that TrumpCare abandons patients suffering from mental illness and substance use disorders at the very moment they need access to care most. Take it from them.

“Their bellies were swollen and their fragile limbs covered with sores that would not heal. Clothed in rags, these children of the Mississippi Delta huddled in crumbling shacks with empty iceboxes, not a morsel of food to be found. It was a level of human suffering and despair that brought a New York Senator to tears. Walking, stunned, from one hovel to the next, Senator Robert F. Kennedy saw conditions that rivaled what he’d seen in third-world countries.” Click here to read my op/ed about the bipartisan roots of our nation’s food stamp program with Peter Edelman, who was an aide to my grandfather.
For your long drives or delayed flights this weekend, be sure to download my Pod Save America debut where we discuss everything from TrumpCare to the proper balance between avocado and toast.

﻿It doesn't matter how big or tough or rich or brave you are.  None of us are invincible. Even the mighty need mercy. So we fight -- day and night -- for a country that treats health care as a right and not a privilege. Watch my Democratic Weekly Address here.
Happy 4th!

"I know there are averages and statistics and stories. But there are also miracles, science and hope. I choose to believe in the latter." -- Watch Danya Thompson share her powerful, personal story and make the deeply human case against TrumpCare.

The faces of our nation’s health care debate aren’t politicians. They are the families fighting for their loved ones every single day. You cannot hear stories like the ones I heard in Taunton and believe that the pain and suffering in this country will be cured by abandoning our neighbors in their time of need.

The second stop on our health care tour last Friday brought us to HMEA, Inc. in Bellingham. Walking through their halls and seeing the smiles on the faces of those they serve renewed my resolve to fight against deep, draconian cuts to Medicaid. You can read more here:
Willingness to defend the integrity of our democracy is not a Democratic or Republican principle – it’s an American one and it’s being tested today.

They can tweak the margins all they want.   TrumpCare still fundamentally restructures American health care into two systems: One for the powerful and the privileged, the healthy and the wealthy, and another, lesser system for everyone else.   Speaker Ryan calls this freedom. I call it agony. President Trump calls it greatness. I call it gutless.   ICYMI, watch my full response to the GOP health care plan here.
Washington today isn't just threatening the laws that protect us. They are threatening the very idea that we are all worthy of protection.

With the technology available to us today, there is no excuse for a system where hearing loss is a debilitating diagnosis. Proud to see my bill with Congresswoman Marsha Blackburn pass the House yesterday with broad bipartisan support.
Bigotry is the last thing this country should offer ANY brave man or woman who volunteers to defend us.
A health care system that fails you when you're sick is a health care system that fails -- period. #TrumpCare
To be clear: the new version of Trumpcare deems maternity care, mental health treatment and prescription drugs as essential for Members of Congress but not the rest of Americans.

A health care system that segregates the sick and suffering ignores the most basic human truth that none of us are invincible. We cannot predict when it will be our parent diagnosed with Alzheimer’s, our child with autism, or our spouse with cancer. So we fortify a system strong enough to catch any one of us when we fall to our knees. A great nation would not only shoulder this responsibility, it would be proud to do so. TrumpCare runs from it, placing that burden on our families at their most vulnerable moment and making our country small and weak.

Inherent in our nation’s right to religious freedom is a promise that my belief cannot be used to infringe on yours or do you harm. The Religious Freedom Restoration Act was intended to protect against such distortions of faith, not to justify them. Unfortunately in recent years, that legislation has been used as cover to erode civil rights protections, equal access to health care and child labor laws. In response to an Administration that continues to back away from civil rights protections, I reintroduced the Do No Harm Act with Congressman Bobby Scott to restore the sacred balance between our right to religious freedom and our promise of equal protection under law.

Our soldiers do not discriminate. They do not offer to pay the ultimate sacrifice to protect some lives and not others. Their country owes them that unwavering protection in return. With the bipartisan rejection of this hateful amendment, Congress reaffirmed a promise that should have never been in question: that we will defend the rights of all of those who defend us. The fact that this proposal got as far as the House Floor is a searing reminder that we must stay vigilant.

Over the next few days and weeks, we will be fighting with every ounce of energy in our body to defeat Trumpcare. But we also have to offer our own vision of what a decent and fair health care system looks like. That's why I introduced a bill with Rep. Grace F. Napolitano that would wholly guarantee mental health coverage for the nearly 9 million children and pregnant women covered by CHIP.

Our goodness is our strength. Thank you NYPD, Massachusetts State Police and Boston Police Department (Official) for reminding us.

There is nothing more fundamentally American than the belief that our people survive, they endure, they rise to fight another day. They deserve a government unafraid to jump in the ring by their side. Not one that crumbles under the pressure that American families bravely face every single day.
To the thousands of transgender Americans bravely serving our nation in uniform: Thank you. We do not take your patriotism for granted.
Our soldiers do not discriminate. They do not offer to pay the ultimate sacrifice to protect some lives and not others. Their government owes them that courtesy – that decency – in return.

Too many have fought too hard to bury hatred and intolerance in our nation's past to allow it to resurrect in Charlottesville. Disgusting and dangerous.

Explicitly rejecting the KKK, neo-Nazis and all white supremacist organizations should not require two days of meetings and discussions. It should be immediate. Every second of silence emanating from our President will only render any eventual words of condemnation meaningless.

For those of us who have never known a country where schools were segregated and water fountains were labeled, we are forever grateful to those who shed their blood and tears to shine a light on the only side worth standing on. A side that believes our nation is and always will be strengthened by our diversity and driven by our decency. We will not allow the President’s false equivalency of this weekend’s events to divide us and we will always remain proudly standing and fighting on the side of tolerance and progress.
My heart goes out to the people of Barcelona. Praying for all of those lost and injured in today’s attack.

We raise our unified voices today so that tomorrow our children will never know a world where racism, anti-Semitism and bigotry of any form are given cover. So that they will never know a country where statues memorializing white supremacy could ever be considered beautiful. Or a community where quiet American streets are flooded with chants of hatred and intolerance.
“We draw strength, not from those who chose silence, but from those who choose to refuse to be silenced,” said Kennedy.

To the thousands of brave transgender men and women in uniform, your service and your sacrifice will never be discounted. A grateful nation knows that you defend the rights and safety of every single American regardless of color, creed, sexual orientation or gender identity. Just like you fight for us within our shores and far beyond them, we will fight with you to overturn this bigoted ban in the days ahead.

Nobody is above the law, period. Tonight, President Trump put bigotry before justice.
Courage is volunteering to defend our nation. Weakness is questioning the service of transgender troops without looking them in the eye.

As it journeyed across the country, the Save My Care bus collected the strength and decency of American families and channeled that energy into our enduring fight for compassionate health care. It is a fight for the character and content of this nation. And make no mistake: It's a fight we'll win.

It's a cruel hand that extends the American dream and then steals it away. With a fierce faith in our country's word, DREAMers walked out of the shadows and bravely embraced the only home they've ever known. In contrast, tonight President Trump gave in to his own dark fear of diversity and punished hundreds of thousands of young people for simply trusting the United States.

Privatization of the MBTA. An underground economy that undermines critical wage and benefit protections. Nurses and teachers forced to defend their livelihood as they care for our families. When it comes to the state of labor in this country, our fight starts right here, in the trenches of a mighty Commonwealth.   Because we don’t get to rest on our economic laurels if our cops and firefighters can’t afford housing in the communities they put their lives on the line to protect. Because the most powerful economies in the world don’t just court the right CEOs or entice the right businesses – they proudly support the workers that carry industry on their backs. Because if Massachusetts won't defend worker's rights and livelihood, who will?
DREAMers embody America’s story: diverse, determined, rooted and hopeful. Instead of rewarding that patriotism, this Administration is using their livelihood for cheap political gain.
A los 800,000 DREAMers que aman este país y orgullosamente lo llaman su hogar: Estamos con ustedes. Esta lucha sólo es el principio.

Time and again, we ask our children to pick up the pieces of the precious things we broke, the sacred resources we took for granted, the battles we were too afraid to fight. President Trump slammed the door on 800,000 young DREAMers, but Congress has the power to say never again. We will not ask the youngest among us – those DREAMers – to force a country’s conscience awake with their bare hands.
Awestruck by the resilience of folks here in Houston. Grateful for the chance to help out.

Sixteen years ago our towers fell, but a nation rose. From the wreckage of terror grew the true profile of American patriotism -- selfless, indomitable, fearless and proud. In honor of all we lost, may we never take our common cause for granted.

Senate Republicans think you’re tired of fighting back against a health care system that pits American against American. They’re wrong. Raise your voices even louder and put an end to this final version of TrumpCare one last time.
TrumpCare isn’t federalism. It is a direct attack on states that believed their citizens deserved health care and expanded Medicaid.

We stand with our fellow citizens in Puerto Rico and Congress should send aid today. Please share the important contact information below for families searching for loved ones.

In this country, we do not retreat. We stumble and we struggle. But we press on. TrumpCare is nothing more than a white flag. An admission that the wealthiest nation on earth can treat a child in Texas or Massachusetts but not both. That is why we must fight harder than ever before to tell President Trump that we will not accept this cop out.

Millions of Americans are suffering on American soil in Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, and the response of their federal government has been shameful. There should be nothing more important to the Trump Administration and Congress than delivering the aid, support, food, water and electricity that our fellow citizens needed yesterday.

We asked you to raise your voices one last time and you silenced the worst version of TrumpCare yet – thank you. But let me be very clear, President Trump and Republican leadership have not given up and we can’t either. Stay vigilant and together we will defend health care as a right for all Americans.

In just a few minutes last night, one man took at least 58 innocent lives and forever altered thousands more. To all of those grieving mothers, fathers, brothers, sisters, sons, daughters, friends, colleagues and first responders, you are in our prayers, our thoughts, our hearts. You are not alone.   Days like today have become tragically, uniquely American. But we are not powerless in this gun violence epidemic. We are not helpless. We are not bystanders. This is our country -- our home. It's up to us to say enough. No more. Not here.

Yesterday morning, our nation welcomed thousands into America’s fastest growing community – families and friends with a gaping hole in their hearts caused by a bullet. A community devastated by gun violence whose pain will remain long after the cameras leave. For them, and for us, ending gun violence isn’t political, it’s personal.

The Children's Health Insurance Program is the latest victim of GOP's insistence that health care is a zero sum game; that the only way to help one family is to devastate another.

It is a dark day in our nation’s history when those tasked with defending our civil rights open the door to government sponsored discrimination. Barely buried underneath the Attorney General’s empty assurances to transgender Americans is a clear message that the Trump Administration will not defend them from hatred. And despite his protestations, decades of court decisions have made clear that sex discrimination laws still protect transgender people.  As President Trump continues to attack the very idea that we are all worthy of protection, my colleagues and I on the Transgender Equality Task Force would like every transgender American to know that we stand with them and we will continue to fight back against these bigoted policies.

Workers on factory floors across our country are bringing innovative products to market and strengthening our manufacturing sector every single day. On Manufacturing Day, we celebrate the men and women who have carried our economy on their shoulders for generations.
It's 2017. Giving employers a say in family planning is archaic, oppressive, and an affront to both our public health and personal liberty.
Inspiring evening celebrating a great cause at Codman Square Health Center's Men of Boston event. Thanks to Haley House Bakery Cafe for letting me take credit for their food!
Yesterday we celebrated National Coming Out Day. Today we fight for a country that doesn't treat you as less for being yourself.

Segregating the sick and suffering from the wealthy and healthy will not only cause physical, mental and emotional pain, it will bankrupt families facing unexpected tragedies. With his unilateral action today, President Trump alone has obliterated the promise of protection for preexisting conditions and the guarantee of essential health benefits for millions of Americans. More than that, he is capitalizing on his belief that our nation is not strong enough to care for all of our citizens and, once again, he will be proven wrong.   In the midst of an opioid epidemic and a mental health crisis in our nation, President Trump's Executive Order hollows out existing behavioral health parity laws. For those in the grips of addiction, treatment will become inaccessible and unaffordable.  All of my colleagues in Congress who have expressed concern for this epidemic should immediately announce their opposition to this reckless Order.

Workers at Ford Motor Company's Dearborn Truck Plant are the heart of our nation's proud auto industry. It was an absolute honor to meet them during my trip to Michigan and learn more about their work.

With their innovative approach to behavioral health care, Magnolia Clubhouse in Cleveland doesn't just treat patients, it builds a community where staff and members work side by side. Always moving to see so many people who care so deeply about each other.

Great photo recap of our trip to Flint this weekend.

To adequately address this crisis, we need to invest in proven treatment options, expand access to Medicaid, sharpen mental health parity laws, and President Trump and the GOP Congress must abandon their attempts to systematically dismantle our health care system.

Just like their health care plan, the tax proposals offered by House Republicans today ask the struggling and striving to sacrifice while the healthy and wealthy are rewarded. Their tax policies entrench the inequities of a system already tilted towards privilege and power and place our nation’s economic challenges at the feet of working families.
Children and pregnant women who rely on CHIP deserve the same decency and urgency that House Republicans showed the wealthiest among us with their tax plan yesterday.
Images from Sutherland Springs are horrifying and all too familiar. Our hearts are broken for the First Baptist Church congregation.

In this country we aren’t just citizens, we’re stakeholders. We contribute to the common good because we reap the benefit from that investment. But the GOP tax plan  doesn’t make those dollars count. It asks hardworking Americans to scrape their bank accounts so the Trump Administration can turn around and it give it to corporations and their shareholders.
To the generations of brave men and women who have risked life and limb to defend our nation, a grateful country thanks you today and every day.

Let's call the GOP Tax Plan exactly what it is: another attempt by the Trump Administration and the GOP Congress to reward the healthy and wealthy with the sacrifices of everyone else. Just like you put an end to their health care bills, we need you raising your voices and telling your elected officials that our country is better than this.
The GOP Tax Plan is nothing more than a gift to corporations paid for with the sacrifices of working families.

We now know that the National Security Advisor lied to federal law enforcement about his interactions with agents of a foreign adversary that actively sought to influence our presidential election.  The American public deserves to know why without continued interference from the President or anyone else. With Mr. Mueller’s investigation reaching the upper tiers of the Trump Administration, it is absolutely critical that he is allowed to pursue those answers free of any political pressure.

Resilient American cities like Fall River that invest in their working families and local businesses should lie at the heart of tax reform. Instead, the GOP tax plan asks them to trust that the rewards handed to multinational corporations and shareholders will one day be passed down to them. You can stop this bill in its tracks when you raise your voices and reject it.
For decades, Citizens for Citizens has leaned into every challenge facing the Fall River community. Great to chip in yesterday and learn about the food pantry’s fantastic work!

One person’s deeply held religious beliefs should not infringe on their neighbor’s right to live freely and openly. In the Masterpiece Cakeshop case, the Supreme Court can once again reaffirm that in this country you cannot be discriminated against because of your sexual orientation, gender identity, race, or religion. To put an end to this debate, Congress should pass my Do No Harm Act and codify protections against distortions of faith.
Make no mistake, the GOP is planning to pay for their donors' tax cuts with your Medicare and Social Security.

California will always hold a special place in my heart. Amazed by and grateful for the brave firefighters running towards the flames to save lives and homes. To all of our Californian neighbors, please stay safe and heed evacuation warnings.
This year it's on us to get our neighbors covered. There’s one week left to enroll at healthcare.gov - help us get the word out today!
Tell the Trump Administration: the internet is yours to keep, not theirs to take.
To all of those celebrating Hanukkah tonight, may this Festival of Lights bring you peace and joy.

Five years ago – in mere minutes — our nation lost twenty children and six teachers to senseless bullets. No child should suffer that fate. No family should bear that unbearable grief. No country should remain so frozen in the face of such tragedy. We pray for Sandy Hook today and beg for a better, braver nation tomorrow.

Locking the Internet with keys owned by major corporations will restrict economic equity and crush free speech. If President Trump and Chairman Pai refuse to protect consumers from unfair and unjust limitations to an open and free Internet, Congress must respond to the public outcry and uphold net neutrality.

You rejected this Administration’s attempt to sabotage health care once before. We need you again today. Spread the word to help your friends and loved ones #GetCovered at healthcare.gov before tonight's deadline!

Medicare, Social Security, health care, food assistance, heating aid, and VA benefits. Those are the dollars that Paul Ryan and Mitch McConnell are coming after the second their tax plan passes. Just take their own word for it.

The strength and success of our nation should be judged by the strength and success of all Americans, not just the privileged few. Investing in the working Americans who build our economy should have been the absolute priority of any true tax reform. Instead, the GOP tax bill systemically raises their taxes, attacks their health care, and erodes their economic dignity. Then it turns around and asks them to bear the burden of this unfunded corporate tax cut by sacrificing their hard-earned Medicare and Social Security.

Meet James Matthew Kennedy! Born early this morning and doing great. First gift he received was - appropriately - a Patriots football from Grandpa Joe.   Mom, Dad, and Big Sister Eleanor are exhausted, over the moon and deeply grateful for your support.
Wishing everyone a joyful, peaceful and merry Christmas!

The priorities, suggestions and concerns of the 4th District have been an invaluable compass since my first days in office. As citizens seek creative ways to engage with their government now more than ever, this stop in Newton on our third Tour 34 will allow us to build on past conversations, share the resources our office has to offer, and partner with advocates on the ground in our communities to fight for meaningful change.  Doors will open at 1:30PM. Hope to see you there!
